Package jnet

Class CRC

java.lang.Object
jnet.CRC
public class CRC extends Object
Utilities to handle CRC32 generation, application, and vertification for network safety.

Throughout the methods within this class, the following notation is used to refer to data contained in byte arrays:

  • header - a header to allow for safe data I/O. See jnet.Header.
  • payload - a byte array containing the data being sent or received through the socket. This is what is ultimately expected by the programmer and is the only component of the message returned by the send/recv methods of the socket-oriented classes in this library.
  • crc - a 4-byte checksum of payload. The argument to the method CRC::crc32() is referred to as bytes to provide a more generic name, but this method is almost exclusively used to generate a checksum for payload.
  • body - a byte array containing payload + crc in that order.
  • message - the full message sent across the socket, comprised of header + body in that order.
See Also:
  • Header

  • Method Details

    • crc32

      public static int crc32(byte[] bytes)
      Generates a 4 byte CRC as an integer. This method is a wrapper for the use of new java.util.zip.CRC32().

      The CRC32::getValue() routine returns a long which does not necessarily ensure the 4-byte CRC is within any specific 32 bits of the long. Because of this, truncation is insufficient to isolate the CRC bytes as an integer, so the mask 0x7FFFFFFF is used (see Reference 1).

      Parameters:
      bytes - the bytes to generate a checksum for.
      Returns:
      a 4 byte checksum as an int that is assumed to be unsigned.

    • attach

      public static byte[] attach(byte[] payload)
      Adds a 4-byte checksum to the end of the argument payload. If a problem occurs with generating the checksum, null is returned and no error is logged or thrown. payload must contain at least 1 byte, or no checksum will be generated.
      Parameters:
      payload - the byte array to generate a CRC for.
      Returns:
      a new byte array containing payload + crc in that order.

    • check

      public static boolean check(byte[] body)
      Checks for a valid CRC checksum on a byte array. This method assumes the last 4 bytes of the argument represent the CRC valid for the first n - 4 bytes of the array.

      body is guaranteed to remain unmodified; only true or false is returned if the checksum is valid, no bytes are ever changed. Note that false may be returned upon error. In this case an error will be logged using jnet.Log.

      Parameters:
      body - the byte array to check the CRC for.
      Returns:
      true if the given and generated CRC of body match, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • Log

    • checkAndRemove

      public static byte[] checkAndRemove(byte[] body)
      Checks a byte array for a valid CRC and returns the payload. If the checksum cannot be validated, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      body - the byte array to check the crc for.
      Returns:
      the payload of body.
      See Also:
      • check(byte[])
